resources.string: For most devices, Samsung will only supply the latest firmware. Even if you request a different version, Samsung's servers will return the latest firmware file. To avoid potentially flashing the wrong firmware, %1$s will check to see if Samsung is supplying the requested firmware before attempting to download. If the requested and served versions do not match, %2$s will abort the download. For more information on this, check out
Warning! Samsung may not supply the requested firmware!
Please select an encrypted firmware file ending in enc2 or enc4.
May provide a more native look and feel when opening and saving files.

Samsung has started requiring the use of an IMEI or serial number that matches the firmware being downloaded. In many cases, if you use your device's serial number, you'll be able to download firmware for any CSC for your model. Without the correct IMEI or serial, you'll receive error 408 when attempting to download. Bifrost will attempt to automatically generate up to 100 IMEIs to try for any model you enter. You can also set your own IMEIs that should be tried by putting each on its own line in the Edit dialog, or separated by semi-colons in the field itself.
Unable to retrieve firmware history. Make sure the model and region are correct. \nError: %1$s
No binary file found for %1$s, %2$s! Please try a different CSC.
CRC check failed. Please delete the file and download again.
Unable to decrypt firmware. Make sure model, region, and firmware are correct. \nError: %1$s
Unable to retrieve firmware history. Make sure the model and region are correct.
MD5 check failed. Please delete the file and download again.

You requested 
 
%1$s 
 
but Samsung is attempting to serve 
 
%2$s 
 
instead. Are you sure you want to continue downloading?

For convenience, Bifrost automatically capitalizes all characters in the model, region, and firmware fields. However, a few device models contain lowercase characters. Enable this option to download firmware for those models.
Bifrost stores some data such as the last-entered device information and current settings states. Click here to remove that data.

When downloading firmware from Samsung, Bifrost creates two files: the encrypted firmware from Samsung, and a ZIP containing the decrypted firmware files. Enable this option to automatically delete the encrypted file once it's been decrypted.

Error checking for firmware. Make sure the model and region are correct. 
More info: %1$s 
 
%2$s
Unable to verify that Samsung is serving the correct firmware. Are you sure you want to continue downloading?
Invalid firmware string. Make sure all groups are specified.
On Windows 11 and later, Bifrost can apply the Windows Mica effect to the window background, making it look more like a native Windows app.

Invalid IMEI or serial number specified! If you copied the value from your device, make sure it's entered correctly. If Bifrost generated IMEIs for you, please open an issue on GitHub with the model, region, and TAC of a real device (if you have it).
Warning! Bifrost can't download firmware for watches or other accessories. Only phones and tablets are supported।
If you know the decryption key for the file you're trying to decrypt, you can enter it here. Otherwise, leave it blank and Bifrost will retrieve the key from Samsung's servers।

When this option is enabled, an extra text file will be saved when downloading firmware, containing the decryption key provided by Samsung. This key can then be entered on the Decrypter page to decrypt firmware without an internet connect।
